item.title: Crew behaviour:, 6th November
item.description:
The crew are continuously leaving rubbish behind, or dropping rubbish on the floor during collections. They do not clean it and residents are becoming frustrated. Rubbish was left behind on the floor today also.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Culford Grove, Hackney, London

item.title: Lights out, 6th November
item.description:
Two lights in Lydford Road estate by Riverton close are out. Because of this, the alleyway is pitch black at night after work
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alfred Road, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering in Pullens Park, 6th November
item.description:
Since I moved to the area a year ago, there has always been littering in the park, especially bad in and around the dog area. Dogs like to pick up anything, so it's very difficult to walk them in this area. Today, I saw a woman theow bread on the floor. I asked her to pick it up and explained why and that it was littering but she wanted to give it to the birds. She then left. There needs to be more regular cleaning in the dog area and maybe more signs that forbid feeding the birds as well.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thrush Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sharp metal strap edge affixing a post about Trust Cycle UK has damaged my jacket, 6th November
item.description:
I am making contact regarding the metal strap attached to this street light (adjacent to Cafe Nero on Clapham High Street) the sharp protruding edge of which ripped my jacket on 02/11/25. I am currently in process of obtaining a repair quote for same & would seek compensation for costs incurred due to this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 182, Clapham High Street, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves, 6th November
item.description:
Leaves, in Autumn! This is an outrage. Cut down every tree in London immediately, we cannot have people complaining. Whatever next, wet pavements when it rains.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29-42, Wellington Court, St. John's Wood, London

item.title: New pelican crossing gridlock, 6th November
item.description:
You have installed a new pedestrian crossing. This has caused appalling congestion (gridlock) It was always a busy junction, but the crossing has caused a failure, has but 1/2 hour on my journey. Local businesses affected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 401, Southend Lane, Perry Vale, London
